intro: Dorstenia mannii var. humilis, commonly known as the dwarf false arrowhead, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves that resemble a spiral staircase. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often appearing in the axils of the leaves. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
